articles.author: Geir Moulson | AP
articles.title: German foreign minister flies to Libya to push peace effort
articles.description: Germany's foreign minister is flying to Libya to meet one of the country's rival leaders, Gen. Khalifa Hifter, in a bid to push forward troubled efforts to secure a cease-fire
articles.content: Foreign Minister Heiko Maas trip to Benghazi comes two days after Libyas rival leaders left Moscow without reaching an agreement. Hifters forces have been on the offensive since April, laying siege in an effort to capture Tripoli and battling with militias al… [+1781 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Right-wing parties in Israel unite, rejecting fringe list
articles.description: Religious-nationalist parties in Israel have joined forces ahead of the country's unprecedented third straight election in one year
articles.content: Jewish Powers top candidates for the Knesset are successors of the late rabbi Meir Kahane, who advocated the forced removal of Palestinians and a Jewish theocracy. Kahanes Kach party was banned from the Israeli parliament in the 1980s, and the U.S. classified… [+1106 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Pakistan arrests 71-year-old man in 2005 killing of UK woman
articles.description: A Pakistani man has been arrested in the 2005 killing of a British woman police officer who was gunned down as she responded to a robbery in the city of Bradford in 2005
articles.content:
British police officer Sharon Beshenivsky, a 38-year-old mother of three, was shot and killed outside a travel agency in Bradford while responding to an armed robbery call.
Six men were later arrested in Britain but Khan, who was suspected of being the armed… [+546 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Taiwan holds latest military drills following elections
articles.description: Taiwanese marines are staging drills as part of a series of military exercises following the reelection of pro-independence President Tsai Ing-wen
articles.content:
Other exercises earlier in the week featured Taiwans air force, which is undergoing a major upgrade with the acquisition of the latest version of U.S. F-16 fighters and other advanced technology.

articles.author: Cara Anna and Lauran Neergaard | AP
articles.title: 3 African countries trying out 1st malaria vaccine in babies
articles.description: Babies in three African nations are getting the first vaccine for malaria in an unusual pilot program
articles.content:
With the vaccine, the hope is to help small children through the most dangerous period of their lives. Spread by mosquito bites, malaria kills more than 400,000 people every year, two-thirds of them under 5 and most in Africa.
Seven-month-old Charity Nangwar… [+6621 chars]

articles.author: Aron Heller and Isabel Debre | AP
articles.title: Experts say Med Sea altered by Suez Canal's invasive species
articles.description: As Egypt marks the 150th anniversary of the Suez Canal's opening, marine biologists are bemoaning one of the famed waterway's lesser known legacies — the invasion of hundreds of non-native species
articles.content: The influx has increased significantly since Egypt doubled its capacity in 2015 with the opening of the The New Suez Canal, raising alarm in Europe and sparking criticism from various countries along the Mediterranean basin. The sharpest criticism comes from … [+6045 chars]

articles.author: Rod McGuirk | AP
articles.title: Australia firefighters save world's only rare dinosaur trees
articles.description: Specialist firefighters have saved the world's last remaining wild stand of a prehistoric tree from wildfires that razed forests west of Sydney
articles.content:
The firefighters set up an irrigation system to keep the so-called dinosaur trees moist and pumped water daily from the gorge as the blaze that had burned out of control for more than two month edged closer.
